etymology.description: 华(華 ‘Chinese; splendid’) + 侨(僑 ‘sojourn; reside abroad’) = overseas Chinese.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to Chinese nationals or ethnic Chinese residing outside China, often with continuing ties to the homeland. In stricter usage, it denotes citizens living abroad, contrasted with 华人 for ethnic Chinese who have taken foreign nationality.
etymology.simplification: 華 → 华 by adopting an older variant/cursive form with fewer strokes; 僑 → 侨 by simplifying the phonetic 喬 to 乔 under the person radical 亻 to reduce strokes.

parts.english: sojourn; reside abroad; temporary; overseas (in compounds)

examples.chinese: 他说自己是华侨(他說自己是華僑)，在国外工作多年(在國外工作多年)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuō zìjǐ shì huáqiáo, zài guówài gōngzuò duō nián.
examples.english: He says he is an overseas Chinese and has worked abroad for many years.

examples.chinese: 许多华侨在春节回乡探亲(許多華僑在春節回鄉探親)。
examples.pinyin: Xǔduō huáqiáo zài Chūnjié huíxiāng tànqīn.
examples.english: Many overseas Chinese return home to visit relatives during the Spring Festival.

examples.chinese: 政府设有华侨事务办公室(政府設有華僑事務辦公室)，服务海外同胞(服務海外同胞)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ shè yǒu huáqiáo shìwù bàngōngshì, fúwù hǎiwài tóngbāo.
examples.english: The government has an Overseas Chinese affairs office to serve compatriots overseas.
